body: This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121)

comment_regular_data.body:
Review status: 0 of 11 files reviewed at latest revision, 14 unresolved discussions.

---

*[src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientListSpec.hs, line 27 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7Ttmuiw5XA9pa0CpF:-Kb7Ttmuiw5XA9pa0CpG:b-9aq7mv) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientListSpec.hs#L27)):*
> ```Haskell
>   it "has no more than maxSize elements" $
>     property $ \clientList ->
>         Map.size (ClientList.nodes clientList) `shouldSatisfy` (<= ClientList.maxSize clientList)
> ```

Indentation is 2 spaces. We can talk about changing that, but then we should change it everywhere at once, in a separate PR.

---

*[src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientListSpec.hs, line 57 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7TyyLC5EvPL4zbZHB:-Kb7TyyLC5EvPL4zbZHC:b-ixwb34) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientListSpec.hs#L57)):*
> ```Haskell
>           sortNodes = sortBy $ comparing nodeDistance
>         in
>           take (ClientList.maxSize clientList) (sortNodes allNodes) `shouldBe` sortNodes keptNodes
> ```

Unindent by 2 spaces.

---

*[src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs, line 28 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7VJjpdQVVh4Nd8Pgw:-Kb7VJjpdQVVh4Nd8Pgx:b1wzuto) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs#L28)):*
> ```Haskell
> 
> 
> getAllBuckets :: KBuckets -> [[NodeInfo.NodeInfo]]
> ```

Add `import Network.Tox.NodeInfo.NodeInfo (NodeInfo)`. Generally I've added unqualified imports for the type names and qualified imports for the modules.

---

*[src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs, line 72 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7WSOdEIHBY9W9jMKY:-Kb7WSOdEIHBY9W9jMKZ:b-owc0de) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs#L72)):*
> ```Haskell
>       afterAdd0 `shouldBe` afterAdd1
> 
>   it "buckets have maximum size bucketSize" $
> ```

"it buckets have maximum size" isn't a sentence. I've been trying to keep these tests in the \*spec style with "describe foo: it does bleh, it has blah, it is bork". In this case, you're describing two properties of "buckets": they "have max.." and "have base key...".

---

*[src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs, line 74 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7WopHOxWuJcr-H4pU:-Kb7WopHOxWuJcr-H4pV:b-xvtcuk) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs#L74)):*
> ```Haskell
>   it "buckets have maximum size bucketSize" $
>     property $ \kBuckets ->
>       mapM_ (`shouldSatisfy` (==KBuckets.bucketSize kBuckets) . ClientList.maxSize) $ Map.elems $ KBuckets.buckets kBuckets
> ```

Add space after `==`. I almost always avoid contracting token sequences. In this case, it hints that `==` and `KBuckets.bucketSize` are more tightly connected than the following `kBuckets`, while actually you're doing `(== (KBuckets.bucketSize kBuckets))`, making this contraction actively confusing.

---

*[src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs, line 78 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7XIba9QVdZ9jTPwzD:-Kb7XIba9QVdZ9jTPwzE:bpspmb2) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs#L78)):*
> ```Haskell
>   it "buckets have base key baseKey" $
>     property $ \kBuckets ->
>       mapM_ (`shouldSatisfy` (==KBuckets.baseKey kBuckets) . ClientList.baseKey) $ Map.elems $ KBuckets.buckets kBuckets
> ```

I've switched from the `foo $ bar $ cow x` style to `foo . bar . cow $ x` style for two reasons:
1. It makes it clearer that we're applying a composition of functions to some value.
2. Factoring out that composition and giving it a name becomes a matter of just cut&paste instead of cut&paste and then replacing `$` with `.`.

In this particular case, as well as the previous and the next, changing it to composition rather than application also allows for eta-reduction, making it a beautiful `property $ some . function . composition`.

---

*[src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs, line 120 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7YSc2VUWK-D09rtN6:-Kb7YSc2VUWK-D09rtN7:b3x3o1o) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/testsuite/Network/Tox/DHT/KBucketsSpec.hs#L120)):*
> ```Haskell
>       property $ \kBuckets ->
>         let
>           nodes             = KBuckets.foldNodes (\ns n -> ns++[n]) [] kBuckets
> ```

I'm a bit unhappy about this `O(n^2)` algorithm. It's mine, but perhaps change it to `O(n)` if it doesn't become too ugly? Also in the other test you copied from this one.

---

*[src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientList.lhs, line 54 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7QSGfOPwcTW6L6L1q:-Kb7QSGfOPwcTW6L6L1r:b3dw8w9) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientList.lhs#L54)):*
> ```lhaskell
>   { baseKey = publicKey
>   , maxSize = size
>   , nodes = Map.empty }
> ```

Align `=` and put `}` on a separate line (makes it easier to reorder bindings).

---

*[src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientList.lhs, line 101 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7QrpDYq3a84FVUcSk:-Kb7QrpDYq3a84FVUcSl:bvr9tx5) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientList.lhs#L101)):*
> ```lhaskell
>     Map.delete $ Distance.xorDistance publicKey $ baseKey clientList
> 
> -- |mapTake is Data.Map.take in >=containers-0.5.8, but we define it for
> ```

`-- | 'mapTake' is 'Data.Map.take' ...`

*[src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientList.lhs, line 130 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7Q1zuRh2FOoDXdr3w:-Kb7Q1zuRh2FOoDXdr3x:b-ealz1r) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/ClientList.lhs#L130)):*
> ```lhaskell
> 
> instance Arbitrary ClientList where
>   arbitrary = do
> ```

This is an Applicative do: `arbitrary = genClientList <$> arbitrary <*> arbitrarySizedNatural`.

*[src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/DhtState.lhs, line 76 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7Yvf1Nqxq5kq--lsv:-Kb7Yvf1Nqxq5kq--lsw:b-niqze5) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/DhtState.lhs#L76)):*
> ```lhaskell
> 
> The maximum size of the Client List is set to 8.
> (Must be the same or smaller than the bucket size of the close list to make
> ```

Is this "must" enforced? What happens if it's smaller? Is there a test that shows the effects?

*[src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/DhtState.lhs, line 195 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7RFgRO9lRaE7C6_Hd:-Kb7RFgRO9lRaE7C6_He:bratju8) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/DhtState.lhs#L195)):*

> ```

*[src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/DhtState.lhs, line 213 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7Z5bi0-ebX6wr_Bef:-Kb7Z5bi0-ebX6wr_Beg:b5a8one) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/DhtState.lhs#L213)):*

> ```

*[src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/KBuckets.lhs, line 174 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121#-Kb7Z_qQYdKPNxy9ZiYn:-Kb7Z_qQYdKPNxy9ZiYo:b-f8awhq) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/hs-toxcore/blob/e50148d51573cf98d4fbc92f695a2b9ac47c4be2/src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/KBuckets.lhs#L174)):*

> ```

I have mixed feelings about having part of the function body on the same line as the name binding.

What does hlint say about this? My version (1.9.21) doesn't complain about it: ```haskell addUnlessBase clientList | NodeInfo.publicKey nodeInfo == ClientList.baseKey clientList = clientList | otherwise = ClientList.addNode nodeInfo clientList ```
hlint 1.9.32 tells me: src/tox/Network/Tox/DHT/DhtState.lhs:198:5: Suggestion: Redundant guard Found: addUnlessBase clientList | otherwise = ClientList.addNode nodeInfo clientList Why not: addUnlessBase clientList = ClientList.addNode nodeInfo clientList --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/hs-toxcore/121)*

commit.message: use "non-negative" rather than "positive" when 0 is permitted
put some material where it belongs

ClientList, used in Search Entries and k-buckets

This neatens the k-buckets implementation without changing their
behaviour, and brings Search Entries to spec. The term 'Client List'
comes from c-toxcore, and could perhaps be made more descriptive.

implement review suggestions

title: Single data structure for a k-bucket and for a search entry list
